page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Employment in the area is generally of the agricultural kind. Farmers tend to have a great deal of help from their families, wives and children. The children are always particularly keen to help out as a source of extra pocket money. The need for Unions and labour related problems are therefore quite rare. Apart from farming there is the "Cae Rhys" Riding School, the "Travellers Inn", and a Chicken rearing farm all run by their owners. The rest of the inhabitants are Senior Citizens with only two people employed outside the area. Unemployment is unknown in the area as yet, and it is hoped will never become an evil in their midst.
